title: BES Grants | Ecological Funding Opportunities (Active Round)
Climate Change and Human Health Seed Grants
description: Provides seed funding for research projects that explore the complex and crucial intersection between climate change and human health.
detailed_overview: This program offers seed grants to support research at the intersection of climate change and human health. Applications are currently being accepted. Although listed as a rolling deadline, the next specific application due date is January 22, 2026, at 3:00 pm ET.
eligibility: Not specified in snippet (Implied for researchers/institutions capable of submitting a formal proposal).
application_requirements: Refer to Application Instructions and FAQ for specific required documents

title: Research for Understanding PFAS Uptake and Bioaccumulation in Plant and Animals in Agricultural, Rural, and Tribal Communities
deadline: Not specified on this page. Status as 'Open Grant' suggests current availability, but no application deadline is provided.
description: Funding for research to understand the uptake and bioaccumulation of PFAS (per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances) in plants and animals within agricultural, rural, and Tribal communities.
detailed_overview: This specific opportunity falls under the EPA's broader Ecosystems Research Grants program. The overall program funds research aimed at protecting ecosystems and the air and water resources that provide benefits for humans and other living things. Research areas include evaluating how air pollution affects ecosystems, protecting natural water resources and their supporting watersheds, developing new strategies for watershed management, reducing water-related energy demands, and establishing innovative solutions for nutrient pollution. This grant specifically targets understanding chemical contaminant pathways in vulnerable environments.
eligibility: Not specified on this page. Eligibility requirements will be detailed in the official funding opportunity.
application_requirements: All forms referenced in the official funding opportunity
Forms available to download from the 'Funding Opportunities: How to Apply and Required Forms' page
geography: United States (focused on Agricultural, Rural, and Tribal Communities)

title: Funding Support for 2025 Annual Meeting (Includes Joan Ehrenfeld Award)
